number of helpful: 12 of 22 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												Awful. Not worth the money even though I got it on sale. Keep looking for a good game and don't trust good reviews, not even totalbiscuit.pc optimization and graphics: Can't max the game at 1080p 60 fps on an overclocked r9 290. Turning the settings down I still see dips below 60 fps. The game also seems to want to lock itself to 50fps at certain points for no reason. The menu screens still have xbox buttons on them. This is the worst console port I have ever played. The worst. They didn't even add anti aliasing, just a quality slider and shadows options and that's it. I had to force AA with radeon pro because catalyst control center doesn't work for this game. The graphics are awful. I'm no professional artist, but I could make a better looking game than this. I would never have the audacity to sell a  product that looks like this. The graphics could have been for the original xbox. Actually, halo 2 looked better. The shadows/shading had to be fixed with mods so I could see during daylight. Tried other mods but held off because I read mods like the sweet Fx ones made the game even more buggy than it already is. The screen shots you see on the store page are BULL SHOTS, and even from the bull shots you can tell the game looks a bit dated. The game doesn't look as good as the store page screen shots  at all. It looks like they downsampled and added better shading or something. Sad how bad steam's quality control on games is. soundtrack: Forgettable is all I can say. I can't even hum one song off the top of my head. Once looking up some music on youtube, it was alright and set a decent tone.story: Hardly there, and not worth paying attention to any real progression. More of a survival game I guess. ♥♥♥♥ that, I want  a good story driven, open world zombie game. Instead I got this garbage.gameplay: A little better on this front but still nothing special. The pros include open world with some missions that pop up along side the "main missions" to keep things interesting. However, that's where it ends. The cons are plentiful and make the game worthless even if you are someone who can look past the bad graphics. The management is no fun. The resources are limited with unlimited zombies. Haven't run into the problem of people getting killed off while not even playing the game like some have reported, but I have had to deal with the infuriating save system. The saves are auto save only with no loading previous saves. The inventory system is dumb, with the largest backpack barely holding anything. Looked for a fast travel mod so I could atleast drop stuff off at base and couldn't find one. Half the time I can't even switch to another character or get another character to follow me, and there seems to be no reason.(glitch/bug not a matter of team liking me) As soon as the fact that  its open world wears off, which will be within an hour or two considering how small the world is, you'll just see the game as repetitive: go here, clear area/loot house/ hold off incoming zombies mission over and over. The world sucks to explore. Like really sucks. More shallow than an ubisoft open world game. If you're someone who thought skyrim was shallow, stop reading this review, cancel all thoughts about this game, and do something else. Guns are unsatisfying (probably due to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ mouse support) and all feel about the same except for maybe the shotguns having spread and less range. Silencers were poorly implemented and break for no reason after a set number of shots. The decision to include no human enemies with guns was a terrible idea. Look at a game like dead island, which I also thought was pretty bad, but atleast had decent gameplay pacing with the mix between zombie and human enemies. The AI of your team and zombies is horrible and makes the game even more horrible to play. Overall, this game is bad, even for an indie game. It won't hold your interest if you have some sort of standards for games, even if you are a zombie fanatic.

												The game is very fun at first. The idea of being thrown in a zombie infested city and building your own fort/gathering resources is pretty awesome. After about ~7 hours or so the game begins to show its flaws. Missions are repetitive/annoying, resources are abundant, game combat is questionable. content:
Posted: December 9, 2013
												I admit that I am coming in as a disatisfied customer in this review, but ultimately I feel it has to be said. From a larger developer, I would be just as angry- but the game's store page has no reference to any incompatibilities it might have had or anything like that. After buying it, and being super psyched to play it after seeing a few let's plays; I downloaded it and waited until everything was done; only to find that when I finally booted the game I was greeted iwht a message 'This game is incompatible with your graphics card, the game was not built to support onboard graphics cards' referencing the model my computer uses. All the while, I can play Skyrim or Xcom on medium settings just fine; but I got to see the menu of the game and if I tried to start a game was greeted with a black screen. I wouldn't have ended up upset or irritated at the game at all, which now just taunts me in my library view; if I hadn't picked it up and spent 15$ (Thankfully it was on sale) only to end up finding that it's paying that much for a game that functionally works; less than even a coaster. I'm glad the game is successful, but one thing I can only hope of indie developers, especially those who have went past the 'bug-testing stage' of their games; is that they follow the method of Paradox Interactive, and actually give support on these matters. While I want to believe in this game, I've basically been shanked for the belief.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2014
												So i was looking for a game thats a bit different from the "kill as many zombies as you can" game and more like a duck and dive, try to survive the zombies sort of game. i was not dissapointed. From the start it is clear that this game isnt about zombie death count, its about surviving the Zombie apocolopse by gathering resources, befriending the local population and securing the best territory to enable to to live and survive in relative comfort.Firstly the bad bits about gameplay. there are quite a few bugs, casually looting some food and a zed decides to come through the wall and mall me. luckily only the one! the graphics are in no way next gen, which i kind of like in a way, it gives it a retro zombie authenticity lacking from some apocoliptic games. loss of stamina is annoying, especially when a horde of zeds decides to turn up! but in truth it adds a little more dynamic to the game, making you think about exit stratagies before searching a property, worth noting, check rooms and close doors behind you!I've found using vehicles to draw enemies out and run them over was a good strategy but you'll go through a fair few vehicles this way so ensure you are able to repair them, and also dont ram a juggernaught at full speed, nasty consequences as i found out when i lost one of the games first notable characters. Yes when someone dies they stay dead, no continues or respawns, there gone! Gonna wrap this up now by saying if you want something a bit different from the normal zombie game, this could probably be for you, with a price tag thats not too bad considering the other titles out there. not quite completed this yet but i'm around 10 hours in and im still hooked, i'll be downloading the dlc once the games complete for more action!

content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												I had high hopes for an open world zombie game and State of Decay delivers. The survival aspect is fun, because once you use up items they don't respawn making you think about everything you take and do. The combat is satisfying once you know which weapon abilities you choose to use and there are plenty of weapons to boot. I wish the story was longer and hopefully in the future more new areas and cities will be added as well as steam workshop support. All in all it's a very good time and the bugs aren't numerous which is a plus. Would 100% reccommend.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												State of Decay is what I had hoped Day Z was before playing it. I prefer single player games for some concepts and this fit the bill nicely. The game is basically a "build your zombie survival base and make it a functional community" game. You start off with very little and build up to some formidable equipment. I like how the game is effectively open world exploration combined with resource management. Once I started playing, I couldn't really stop. Pros: combat system - guns or melee, they are both pretty solid ways of handling the hordes!- dynamic environment- wide range of weaponry- simple and rewarding character development- open world exploration- Handle a zombie apocalypse in your own wayCons: Resolution capped at 1280.....a shame!-perma-death! If your juiced up character dies....its gone forever with its developed stats!! (realism?)-A little bit too much micro management with side quests (repetition)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												One of the best zombie survival games there is, State Of Decay is an extremely well-made game and when I found out about it I realized I had finally found "The Game." "The Game" I had been searching for but could never find. "The Game" that doesn't force you to restart missions if they fail, where failed missions effect the storyline. "The Game" that requires you to battle waves of zombies for resources needed for your own survival. "The Game" where you aren't just one linear character, but where instead at any instant your favorite character can die and death is permanent. In State of Decay, it is necessary to scavenge for resources and every single character has their own needs. Every character in State of Decay has their own unique personality and (not including the main story's characters and Lily) have randomly generated names. Every step you take could be your last, one mistake and you become zombie-chow, never to be seen again. But don't worry, that isn't the end of your game! You can earn the friendship of other survivors and recruit them to join your community, and they will become playable if you earn enough trust with them. Nobody is safe and at any minute, any second, the zombies could breach your defenses and you can be left with nothing. Unless you're well prepared. It's fairly easy to prevent total devestation of your community. All you have to do is stay well supplied, and keep your community healthy. Sometimes you'll have to make life-or-death choices. If your favorite character gets infected, will you kill them to protect the community, or will you take the chance of them turning and let them live? Every choice is yours in State of Decay, but it doesn't always work out for you.PROSExtremely Well-ThoughtWorth The MoneyEndless FunRealistic NeedsDay/Night CycleRPG FactorsRequires a Good Strategy to SurviveCONSSeveral bugs (EX: Zombies can sometimes phase through walls)Overall I recommend State of Decay and although there are tons of bugs, Undead Labs is always working to fix them and even add new content now and then! The two DLC: Breakdown and Lifeline are more than worth their inexpensive cost, as they are presented like a whole other game. I give State of Decay a 20/10, but that's my opinion. I feel that if you can afford it, and you're thinking of buying it, (and you're into zombie survival games) then State of Decay is the game for you!

content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												The pinnacle of zombie games, State of Decay has raised the bar for any future zombie games. The mix of base building, driving simulator, and fighting comes together to bring a satisfying experience. My favorite, is the fact that zombies can only be killed with headshots. Add to that the fact that your gunshots will bring more zombies and you have a very finite amount of ammunition and you will end up slugging it out with a 2x4 and golf club. There are no such thing as electrified machetes or goofy weapons. The game has a good mixture of realism without forgetting it is a game. Another aspect is that you dont just play as one character. You can play as any of the survivors that are in your community. Each has there own set of skills and abilities. In the end, this is the zombie game we have been waiting for.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												State of decay is definitely an interesting and addicting game. Which says a lot for a game in a genre that's been beaten to death. What sold it for me was definitely the surviving and recruiting aspect, mixed in with the chance of perma-death. For the surviving aspect, you need to go out and collect supplies like weapons, food, and building material. Most of that can be found in the neighborhood/town, however at some point those supplies can run out and you'll have to scavenge in farther places. Don't feel like going back and fourth? You can move your base/group, somewhere else! It feels very Walking Dead(kinda).Recruiting is also neat. Every survivor has their own set of traits that make them shine, or make them poop. Some might be doctors who boost your infirmary strength, some are athletes who can go for long distances, and there's even some with asthma! I think something that's a little tedious(in a fun way for me) is that you can train people up(some easier than others). Knowing that this game is persistent, even when your not playing, it feels good to set your crew up for success, so you don't come back to a dead camp.Then we got the death aspect. If someone dies, they are gone for good! This includes "story" characters. People in your group can randomly get sick and die if you don't have proper treatment at the time(or act fast enough), I've seen characters mercy kill the sick/wounded(that may just be story though), and sometimes they want you to mercy kill them. Depression and fear can instill fights and suicides. People can go on missions and not come back. If you like to get attached to characters, keeping them alive will be a treat!I think what mostly sold this for me, is that it feels like a much more developed version of an flash game called The Last Stand. I used to love that as a kid, and this game brings it back 10x more. You might like it, you might hate it. But I recommend it!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
												State of Decay is a great game. There is a great, open-world to explore, a church to upgrade, and yes, plenty of zombies to kill.  However, there are a few issues in the game, primarily the frame rate and zombie teleporting. The frame rate drops out of nowhere, stooping to rates of 5-10, though only for a second (long enough for you to get your neck chewed off).  Also, zombies to teleport and respawn almost instantainously, without your realizing. One for instance, popped right in front of me when I was barricaiding a room. Finally for the issues, there is perma-death.  That means, when you dead, YOU DEAD!!! But, none of these minor problems should stop you from playing one of the best zombie games in history.  Combat is fluid, and the ground take-downs are sick.  The amount of blood and gore also makes each swing of a spiked bat murderous and powerful.  Probably one of the game's highest strong points is the sound.  Each moan of a zombie and the shuffiling of the footsteps make your heart skip a beat and wonder where the heck that one (or two, or three) zombie is at.  All and all, State of Decay is an amazing game and an even better zombie survival RPG, witch shouldn't be passed up because of a few minor bugs.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
												This is not the perfect zombie experience... but it makes a really good effort towards it. Short answer: I recommend this game for anyone who likes sandbox or zombie games.Long answer:zombie sandbox game emphasizing survival during the outbreak, have been really enjoying it so far and I think I will easily get another twenty hours out of it before I shelve it.The gameplay is alot of fun and mechanically most things feel fairly good. There are some nice ideas being tried out and for the most part they pay off and result in a fun game. Some more options for difficulty would have been nice but I believe the DLC has that covered.The graphics are not amazing but they are good enough that it does not detract from the game, there is room for more optimization but it ran fine on my machine which is mid range. I have not yet had a crash which is nice.Considering this is the first game from this developer I am actually suprised how good it is, I know I picked it up rather late in the update list so many issues have been fixed. I recommend picking up the DLC if you see it at a good price purely because I believe that a true sandbox mode is needed once the campaign has been finished. I also think needing to purchase this DLC is a let down in terms of value as the mode should be in the main game from the start!There is a small list of annoyances in regards to gameplay but nothing game breaking, the primary being the inability to set survivors with special skills roles (and not go out and risk their lives). Other than that one though nothing else jumps out at me enough that it detracted from the game. So far I have not had any gameplay bugs which is suprising.There is a really good foundation here to build upon and I am sure if they release a sequal it will be amazing.7/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												A very entertaining zombie-survival game with a big area to explore. All buildings are explorable as well as most vehicles you can see so they are stuff to do. The gameplay is about handling your survival in this hostile environment by managing your homebase and your crew, getting differents ressources to improve the basement, feed your people and heal them.. You can perform tasks for other groups of survivors (sidequests) and follow the main quest.This game is easy to learn, it's not hardcore as Day-z (e.g: no personal hunger/thirst management) and you get things done pretty fast. The survival feeling is really there and enjoyable. I played it for around 25 hours before getting bored by doing the same stuff over and over, something i would have come over if there was a multiplayer mode!You got to consider State of Decay as the first step of a concept that is supposed to evolve to a multiplayer game in an upcoming title. It's buggy and does not have a high end graphic engine, but from early access to now things evolved in the right way and that does not influence the gameplay.So yeah, if you can overcome those elements, get it!

												Over all I freaking love this game, it is great. Having said that, there are a few ideas to be add to this awesome game that would make it, in my personal opinion, just that much better. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												First off; this is NOT a zombie killing game. It's a zombie survival game. There's a big difference in how you play.There's also Perma-death. As in "I made the wrong decision, now that survivor is dead for good." So don't spend all your time with one survivor. Because if they die your group will be left considereably weakened overall. That's right. Group. Think in terms of "Group survival" not run-n-gun and you'll be fine.Don't worry though, as the game's not that hard once you figure the mechanics out. Deaths usually involve people running around overconfident in their "skill" at the game, only to aggro several passing Hoards and getting torn to shreds. It's about sneaking. It's about survival. It's not about running about like an idiot, thinking you can take on the entire world alone. I finished the Story mode without a single non-plot related death, after thirty-odd hours. Change the way you play zombie games and you'll find endless enjoyment, especially with the latest Breakdown DLC. That adds a fully story-free Sandbox mode, with lots of Story mode "Hero" character challenges to unlock.Watch a few youtube Let's Play clips like I did. Then buy it!*Note: This game has been on 50% sale in the past, so watch out for them in the future. Highly recommended.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 3, 2013
												I will have to say this is the first time I got a "early acess" game. So far the experience has been good.  I won't rate this game because it is unfinished. However things are looking up for this game.  It has good play mechanics that are unique for zombie games. Others have described it by comparing it to various other zombie games. In all fairness I have to say its got its own flavor and i don't really find the experince repetitive of other games. I recommend  this unfinished game highly i'm sure the finished version will please many zombie fans even more than it does in its current state which is very satisfing game exprience as it is.UPDATE: OK i've had this game a long time now and it's been finished now as well as had a few DLC release for it. So with out further stalling here's my breakdown. The Good: Great story that doesn't hit you in the head with trying to explain zombies.Lots of characters to play as.Nice Tired/food/water mechanic that doesn't consume your game time.Gorgeous graphics. The bad: Seemed a bit short start to finish. I highly recommend you grab the DLC to extent this one.Random graphic slow downs despite having a powerful system. Harsh HDR lighting, some games get this tuned right some don't While this game does look great the contrast  from HDR can be a bit much at times.       Overall I give this game an 82%. Zombie fans wil love it and non zombie fans will stil find it a enjoyable experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												If you like zombie slaying and saving survivors, but always wanted the experience to be a bit more personal, this game is for you.SoD gives a satisfying level of depth to saving people and character building, something largely missing from more acrade style shooters of this type. The base building and resource management is a constant source of both pressure and accomplishment; trying to house, feed supply and develop 20+ people is a challenge.Time becomes a big issue in this game, you won't have enough of it be everywhere and do everything, some things simply have to be prioritized. You may WANT to help those farmers out, but you have a team member in trouble and your base is nearly out of food and ammo...All up, SoD is a pretty well rounded sandboxey survivor sim. Few bugs to speak of, and I've never felt this invested in a zombie game before.  Definite thumbs up.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												I held off reviewing this game for a year because when I first bought it, State of Decay was so absolutely epic that I thought it was too good to be true. Well, one year later, after I've had time to process this game all I can say is this:This game is the greatest zombie apocalypse simulator ever made. I've never played a game that even comes close to the pure genius that is State of Decay (Sorry DayZ fans, but no contest here). While I admit the graphics in this game are a bit dated, there are a few annoying but minor glitches, and after many many hours of this game it can start to feel repetitive but everything else more than makes up for it. The controls are reminiscent of Resident Evil 4, the atmostphere is similar to that of The Walking Dead, and the ability to control an entire group of survivors trying to survive a zombie apocalypse is just the icing on the cake. If you don't already have this game do yourself a favor and BUY IT NOW (At the time of this review it is currently 75% off the base game and both DLC) I also recommend the Breakdown DLC if you're looking for more of a challenge and the Lifeline DLC for an entirely new story. Overall Review:+Brilliant Game Design+Amazing Atmosphere+Hours of Replayability-Slightly Dated Graphics/Minor Glitches9.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												Welcome to Turmbull County and The best Zombie game I have ever played. Build up your strong hold, Keep your morale up, and slaughter horde after horde of zombies, using a vast amount of weapons from Cricket Paddles to a trusty AR-15. The choice is yours.  Fight regular Zombies who move faster than the average leg dragger, Hordes of zombies, SWAT Zombies, Military Zombies, Bloaters who explode into poisonous gas as they die, The extremely fast and deadly Feral who will taer you to pieces and the Big ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, a tall 400lb goliath who pick you up and taer you in half if you're not careful.     Do you build a kitchen, dining room, to keep your group well fed and happyd, or build more bunkhouses to house more survivors. Do you take shelter in the heart of the city surrounded by building to scavenge or take a safer home in the country where supply runs become more difficult. Build a workshop and medical tent to fix your vehicless, and maintain your weaponry, craft silencers, petrol bombs, land mines, home made stimulants, and medicines.     with refrences from every zombie title you seen, Shaun of the Dead to the Walking Dead. Enter BreakDown a new way to play, No story line except thrive and survive, escape and come back to even tougher hordes and stronger special zombies. Complete challenges to unlock your favourite characters from the base game as heroes who come prepared for the slaughter. As you move on to harder and higher levels you can unlock more and more characters, although you only have enough room to escape with six. How long can you survive the onslaught of the undead    One of my personal favourite things is the ability to play as every survivor, and should you fall victim to the harsh world that character is gone.      The new addition Life LIne changes up the map and game style. PLay as the Military, rescue civilians and extract on the chopper after you clear the siege that that threatens your home. Call Predator strikes, artillery and UAV recon ships to help you last another day.I absolutley recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of the Zombie genre.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Do you like DayZ or H1Z1?  Do you need a break from getting killed every 20 minutes by mean random people?  Get this game! This game is a survival game kind of like DayZ but it is single player.  Because of this, it seems to be more polished.  It's a finished game so the graphics look a lot better than early access.  You don't have food and stamina bars, instead you have to find enough food, meds, water, and other stuff for your settlement of survivors.  It's really cool to play this game because you aren't just thinking about your survival, you are thinking of all of the people in your group.  You can also get supplies and build up your base.  Even in a single player game, you feel like you are part of a group because you are always getting supplies for other people.Since this is single player, you get all of the loot!  It's awesome that you don't have to play for 2 hours just to find a can of beans like in other survival games.  The game has perma death, so each time you die with a character he never comes back.  You don't have to start over, you just have to play as another person in your group.  Even though this game doesn't have a great story, what's there is okay, and I felt a lot of tension becasue I didn't want these characters to die.  It also means that if you play this game you will have a different outcome on every playthrough.  It won't really change the story much, but you can level up each survivor differently to add variety to your gameplay.  There are some technical issues here.  I have a pretty powerful laptop that is about equal to the recommended system requirements, but I still had to mod the game to get a respectable framrate.  You will have to mess around with the game to get it to run.  Luckily, the nexus now supports mod for this (and apparantly for any) game.  You can get a mod that disables shadows that will double your framerate easily.  The game is poorly optimised, and keep that in mind if your machine is closer to the minimum requirements.  I have to recommend this game.  I really like survival games, but was getting tired of all the mmo titles because people are jerks.  If you want to change up your survival experience, this is the perfect game for that.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												State of Decay is a delightful game to play. It does have replay value when it comes to the main story, Lifeline, and Breakdown. Now I do have a few complaints, however, but my overall view on the game is still good.The first and foremost complaint would be that there is no co-op. Of course what they did do for it as a substitute is use the in-game AI characters as your partners (the player can ask another member from the home base/community to come watch your back). I do like that idea, but they could have had the option to also have 2-4 player co-op.My second reason would be that there's not really any sort of dynamic weather system in the game. It would of course add to the atmosphere a little and make it seem slightly more like a realistic world, but the overall game is, of course, not a simulator. I just think that, in my opinion, dynamic weather would make the game a little more interesting in a way. Like the rain could affect the zombies somehow or the rain could cause some flooding down in Marshall. Or perhaps some snowy, cold weather that affects everyone. And fog which affects how far you see, so you can't see your enemies (zombies) coming as soon as you want.And the final reason would be a gas system. You know, for the vehicles. And I know in Lifeline there is a gas system for the generator, but that's only until you upgrade it into a solar powered generator. You, as the player, probably will use cars a lot throughout the game, so why not add in a gas system? Because how I see it, gas looks like the last resource you'll have left over that you'll have the most of. Now that's all I have to say about this game. And those reasons above don't really ruin the game for me and make me hate it, I just think it'll add to the experience and make it better. (Well, perhaps not the co-op for some because some people might have some troll-ish friends that'll like.... bring hordes to you, or leave you to battle with the mutated zombies, or even make sure you have to go a long distance just to get a car.)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												A great addition to the much overdone zombie apocalypse genre.  The addition of resource collection and management, base building features, dynamic mission generation, and a living in-game community put a fresh twist on the typical zombie survival horror game.  I enjoy that there is always an element of danger, no matter what you're packing or how strong your character is, and the atmosphere can be quite scary at appropriate times.  The RPG elements of character management meant every survivor had a different feel, and the ability to switch between survivors as the active one became injured or tired took some getting used to but was cool.  I would like to see the game slow down the frequency with which it gives out random missions, because oft times I was over-whelmed with 8-10 potential missions.  It added to the atmosphere of urgency, but the gamer in me didn't enjoy being told I failed to accomplish something because I just couldn't get to it in time.  State of Decay is a really solid entry into the zombie apocalypse base-building resource-gathering RPG genre.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
												State of Decay is quite a fun game if you like somewhat repative game play and less we forget killing zombies! Can't forget the zombies, lots of zombies! The game takes place in the fictional Trumbull Valley which consists of 4 mainish areas and some farmland etc which are all connected in an open world concept. You have a campsite lake where you start of at, and 3 small towns: Spencer's Mill, Marshall City, and Fairfield, the last being the smallest. So at the off set you and a buddy are at the campgrounds and are attacked by some "crazy people"  aka zombies and have no idea what's going on. From there, after some gameplay which includes killing and fending off zombies of course heh, you end up joining a small community at a church in Spencer's Mill. This becomes your first home base. You will now get some missions and objectives to survive the zombies and advance the storyline. Things to do include gathering various supplies like food, ammo, fuel, medicine..very important if you don't want to die or have your fellows turn on you haha. As well as build various structures at your home base in the slots provided, these of course require different supplies previously mentioned and some special items you have to go get. All the while zombies are roming the streets, attacking you wherever you go ^^

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
												This review was posted on 5/31/2014.Now, I wanted to make this post about Lifeline but it wouldn't be fair to talk about only the DLC. I decided to include the game in general.State of Decay is absolutely a must have for those who enjoy Zombie Apocalypse Simulators. The gameplay is fun, suspenseful and sometimes risks need to be taken to survive. When you have to fight zombies it's best to avoid the large groups because you WILL die, it's a problem you may have to deal with and sometimes you'll lose your favorite guy in the group. You will constantly need to restock on supplies especially after you come back, Things will happen even when you're not playing. I know because when I came back the next day there was three to five missions on my map and my supplies went down a couple digits.I enjoyed the campaign, it was interesting and it kept my imagination trying to figure out what was going on. There were times when the game deviated from the main plot but it wasn't too bad. There was also the deal with expendable cars, if you blow up a car it's gone for good. No reparing a dead car so if you can you should make the effort to avoid hitting large crowds of zombies or your vehicle will get bent out of shape.In the Breakdown DLC you are basically playing in sandbox mode, at the start you pick a settlement with what little supplies you have and start where you want in a small area with very few survivors. You can just focus on survival, and there is also the part where if you are able to perform certain tasks you can gain special survivors. But when you're moving on to a higher difficulty in Breakdown you can only bring a handful of your survivors so choose carefully.I don't know much about Lifeline but I will say this, it's a refreshing change of scenery, literally. A whole new map, with a whole new storyline. It may be the same gameplay but I was surprised by how much was changed. There are some bugs but they're not game-breaking.I personally believe this game has alot of potential and with the new DLC I certainly believe Undead Labs is in the process of something great. Take my word for it when I say, if your a fan of Zombie games this one is a must.

												I originally tried the demo on Xbox 360, and the only thing that hit my was how ugly it was. After that it could have played like a Big Mac and an ice cold beer, and I still would have been looking how awful the graphics were.However, I did like the idea, and when I saw it was coming out on PC I was interested. Graphics are not much better, but at least 1080p is supported so it just looks a bit unpolished, and not resembling a zombie minecraft like it does on the 360.Would I recommend? Sure, it's a nice, deep game. Once you get used to the interface then it really opens up. Running missions, improving your character, building bases up. Very fun, and very enjoyable. One thing to be wary of, that bloke you start off as? If he dies, that's it...no coming back you have to be a new person and start levelling their skills again. Makes it quite tense knowing you may actually really lose some hard work if you die.Anyway, top game, well worth it. A bit glitchy here and there, but nothing that's a game killer.Buy.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 12, 2013
												I'd rate this game at a B-. The concept is exactly what I believe people have been waiting for in a zombie game. Base building, character development, finding surviors and resource gathering. It's definately worth a play - but it's a one time play through. If this game comes out with some expansions and DLC then it would make a great game.In this game you start as a survior who came back to small town life to find the world in ruins and zombies everywhere. Your saved by the kindness of a small survival group that sets you on your way. The goal is to build a base camp, gather supplies to run your base and find other survivors then escape the militarized zone. PROSThe 3rd person shooter stand point makes it a fun action game while keeping in mind your need to keep finding materials to build. Keeps the game exciting. Backpack weightlimits and sizes are adequete as well. You'll have to pick and choose what you want to carry out and back and the game keeps this pretty accurate with stamina penalties for carrying more than you should. Character developments are ok as everyone you find has a different history, background and can benefit, or take away from, the work that needs to be done. For instance, you may find someone who was a chef and he can be your cook. Or you may find an alcoholic prick that is lazy and makes morale lower. It's easy enough to kill these people if you dont like them though. This small addition makes you feel a bit of a connection to the characters you find - and yes - anyone you find you can play as and take on missions.The game is wide enough to explore and can keep you on your toes as zombies chase you from one side of the map to the next. Nightfall makes things interesting and there is definately a spook factor. There are many different factions that you can help keep alive, or vice versa, but their role in the game is slim. Zombie base building is always exciting. There are many options to choose from depending on the size of your group and base size. Build your base depending on how you choose to play. Its always fun to come back from zombie killing to see the fruits of your labor flurishing behind a barbed wire fence. Definte plus.CONS:The game lacks story line and substance. The game itself is actually pretty short and the story doesn't leave you in awe. Plus, you find yourself running the same missions over and over again ultimately praying a person from the main quest line shows up so you can move on. The regurgitation of the same missions seems non-stop and frankly gets annoying.Along the lines of substance - you only fight one enemy! What happened to raiders or rival survivors groups! What about fighting the military? This makes it a bit less attractive and in my opinion much easier to win.You also do not get the ability to choose who stays at base camp to defend and work and who runs willy nilly through town. Its frustrating to come back from a mission to see half your people have run off into the city and are unavailble to you - then you have to go off to save them. You dont get to assign duties as the game automatically chooses. It'd be nice to have more control over assignments.Lots of glitches that need to be worked out. You'll run into invisible rocks, walk through closed doors or jump through windows that don't shatter. Zombies will get stuck in walls then suddenly appear. The driving is a tad glitchy and frames can skip causing unintended collisions. Overall its not too bad but little things like that can make the game much more enjoyable.Resources!! There are three main types - Food, Ammo and Fuel? Yes Fuel. I never once used it. That seems more like a commodity especially since the game doesn't give you any reason to have it. Water would seem more appropriate. That seems like an unforgivable oversight in a zombie survival game.OVERALL:Its definately worth one play through - maybe buy it when its on sale. If the creators worked 3 more months on the game it could have been turned into a great game. With some DLCS and patches this game could become great.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
												Highly recommend. While the game is by no means flawless, it delivers a truly worthwhile and novel experience. The difference comes from not simply dealing with stockpile numbers as part of the survival horror experience, but needing to manage and prioritize an entire community of human resources, where and how to build a base, what facilities to maintain, how many and which survivors to recruit, then bother to support and protect. It succeeds in creating a "Sim Community" experience within a survival horror apocalypse, meanwhile still predominantly being a tight action game.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												I would definately recommend this game to anyone who enjoys playing zombie killing games, I loved it!A brief summary about this game: - Its singleplayer and has a great main story (it also has plenty of side missions) - It has a large open world so you can run off to explore and scavenge for resourcres when you want - During the story more new bases become available that you can move to (and upgrade to add different types of rooms eg library, garden, repairshop, etc all with different benefits) if you choose- You meet new survivors and they can join your group and you can change to control each one when you are friendly enough- Each survivor has different traits and you can choose different fight styles to level up - You can use vehicles to move around the map quickly but noise attracts zeds- There are different types of zombies to fight (eg: ones that explode) - When you exit the game real time continues ingame and so depending on how many days it is before you login different things can happen without you, usually resoucres used for different events so you need to build them up again or you need to talk to another survivor who is upset/angry and not coping well.Although there are so many alpha zombie games right now and state of decay is older and only singleplayer, I still believe its a classic and worth grabbing in a sale :)

												I don't know why this game was given such a low score, for an open world zombie survival game it is a LOT better than almost everything else out there.  It is true that it requires a little more polish (more survivers to potentially join you, more base upgrades, more manufacturing options, more gun types [melee weapon selection is pretty damn good], and maybe a few more possible areas for base locations), but that is just nick picking improvements on what is already pretty damn good.  The graphics are consistant and I haven't run into a glitch in the map yet, zombie types and general behaviour is great (the AI rarely does stupid stuff, unlike in many other games), and the voice acting (though somewhat repetative) is great.  I would definately recommend this game to anyone who loves zombie apocalypse survival games.

Posted: February 26, 2014
												This game isn't just another zombie survival game.  Although there are zombies, and quite a few main survival mechanics, the core gameplay is an RPG.  You use influence points in your community to build new things, take weapons and supplies from the storage chest, and even relocate to new bases.  All-in-all, not a perfect game, but it combines the scavenging and survival aspects that I love from zombie games and combines it with RPG aspects that are very well balanced.  The open world is beautiful and does a good job of not looking too repetitive.  Also for the price of just 20 USD, who can complain about what could be hundreds of hours of gameplay?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												7.5/10State of Decay is a lot of fun, but not without it's shortcomings. It plays a bit like GTA, but in a zombie apocalypse based world.It totally nails the feeling of holding back a never ending tide of undead, and slow looming desperation. The gameplay is simple, yet fun. Managing your base and survivors is cool, and you end up becoming attached to your favorites. (I actually restarted once because my "main" character got overrun by zombies.) Building up your base, and upgrading facilities was rewarding while not being overly in depth to the point it was annoying.The combat is easy to pick up, the weapons have variety, and the enemies have a decent amount of difference between them. I like how sound attracted enemies while scavenging for survival tools, and made it seem threatening to be out there, especially when alone. Gunshots attract anything in range of the noise as well (until you get a supressor), which made gunplay a double edged sword.The cons are: Random bugs with Zombie placement/walking through walls. Lack of quest variety, and being unable to do multiple quests at the same time. Overall, I was very pleased. While the game does get bogged down a bit in the late game due to lack of mission variety, it's a very enjoyable experience overall. It's the most realized apocalyptic world I've played in a game. No rails, you can go anywhere, and it's fascinating to see the world they've created. I'd totally recommend this to any Zombie game fan, or anyone wanting a solid gaming experience. Great bang for the buck!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
												This is not the perfect zombie experience... but it makes a really good effort towards it. Short answer: I recommend this game for anyone who likes sandbox or zombie games.Long answer:zombie sandbox game emphasizing survival during the outbreak, have been really enjoying it so far and I think I will easily get another twenty hours out of it before I shelve it.The gameplay is alot of fun and mechanically most things feel fairly good. There are some nice ideas being tried out and for the most part they pay off and result in a fun game. Some more options for difficulty would have been nice but I believe the DLC has that covered.The graphics are not amazing but they are good enough that it does not detract from the game, there is room for more optimization but it ran fine on my machine which is mid range. I have not yet had a crash which is nice.Considering this is the first game from this developer I am actually suprised how good it is, I know I picked it up rather late in the update list so many issues have been fixed. I recommend picking up the DLC if you see it at a good price purely because I believe that a true sandbox mode is needed once the campaign has been finished. I also think needing to purchase this DLC is a let down in terms of value as the mode should be in the main game from the start!There is a small list of annoyances in regards to gameplay but nothing game breaking, the primary being the inability to set survivors with special skills roles (and not go out and risk their lives). Other than that one though nothing else jumps out at me enough that it detracted from the game. So far I have not had any gameplay bugs which is suprising.There is a really good foundation here to build upon and I am sure if they release a sequal it will be amazing.7/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												Yes I recommended it, but only if purchased on a sale price. Why? The game is simply  fun and addictive. However, it doesn't last long, especially if you're like me where you play to win and then toss the game to the side when you're done. After completing the story in about 12 or so hours, I haven't logged back into the game. A large chunk of my weekend was dedicated to this because it had me hooked and I find that hard to come by these days.The gameplay and mechanics are great. Everything runs fairly smooth and keeps you busy with randomized side quests while trying to follow the story. The story itself is a little weak and as mentioned before, short. It's nothing fancy, just basic cut scenes. There times where the story pauses in the game where you seem to be doing side quests for a while until randomly the story picks up again. It's not a bad thing however since you can use that time to gather supplies. There also is apparently a simulated timed feature for when you log out of the game. When you log back in, you may notice your stronghold needs supplies or new random jobs appeared. I didn't really experience this as I played most my hours consecutively. I do think this feature stinks though if you are a casual player since you'd be spending the first half an hour of your game time just doing supply runs and keeping your stronghold hoard free.In conclusion, the game is fun and it feels complete, but I do wish the story had A LOT more to it. Not only in length, but production value. I do recommend, but wait for a deal!PS: I think the DLC "Breakdown" they released should really be part of the main game itself. A little annoying you'd have to spend another 7 bucks to play a repetitive game mode. Currently when you complete the story you are bounced back to your game where the final mission is reset. You can continue to "survive" off resources, but personally I find no replay value in this since there's really nothing to work for. This game was a great teaser to what Class 4 could be like. Class 4 is Undead Labs MMO version of this game in the works right now.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Great game, while I shouldn't really compare this to a game like DayZ, it introduces many zombie survival mechanics that DayZ didnt. for starters the game has a simple but good combat system, LMB to melee, RMB to aim gun and RMB + LMB to fire, there is no need to go into your inventory to de-equip a melee weapon to equip a gun as both can be used at the same time. You can also perform finishing moves with Z and dodge zombie attacks with C. The game also takes a page from L4D and has unique zombies like juggernauts who are huge zombies that can deal a lot of damage and take it at the same time, you also have screamers which attract zombies and riot zombies which are like normal zeds except that are immune to gunfire requiring melee attacks. You are required to lead the group and can make important calls like setting up multiple outposts and improving and moving homes. You have to be very careful in this game and plan out things such as routes and manouvering around zombie hordes and special zeds, one wrong move and you can have your car tipped upside down about to explode with all of your rucksacks of ammo, medicine etc. inside or even have a whole horde chasing you while you have no ammo. Not much to complain right? Well no this game isnt perfect. The game is very repetive and can get boring when you are required to do the same mission in usually the same area over and over, however this hole can be filled with the other 2 DLC that you can download and the game still has loads of replay value. Also, I found that the characters were also boring as some even had the same voices and dialogue which is a shame as they could be more unique. This is still a great game that doesnt get the praise it deserves and if we could see a State Of Decay 2 with more improvements, then you will definitely see that on my wishlist. I am currently playing this game and would recommend this to anyone looking for a cheap, singleplayer experience.Review 2:This game has only got better as I have played on. This game definetely makes zombies a huge threat unlike Day Z (sorry, I had to :0 ) and makes noise in the game have huge consequences. When you are searching containers you could make a loud noise, this causes a huge amount of zombies to swarm to your position; this is made worse by nearby hordes. I got cornered in a storage shed by 10-15 zeds because I reckless and tried to get everything quickly. My strongest character (Marcus) who has max shooting, melee and blunt weapons skills (backed up by a wrench and ak47 custom silenced) almost died from this and was seriously injured as the zeds kept attacking. This meant I couldn't take any out with my AK or wrench and had to find an small opening which was 1 door with 5% of Marcus's health remaining. This is true zombie apocalyspe survival, leaving you with near death experiences and adrenaline pumping. also, choices you make with survivors at the grange has huge consequences as Becca (sorry spoilers) died as I told Quinten she was a, oh how could I say this in the review?, an 'escort'. I now make sure I use quiet or silenced weapons as more powerful guns like the AK47 and River Snake generate a lot of noise (check the wiki for more details). Because of the noise made by the River Snake revolver, one of my group members died as zombies began to swarm us on a normal anger mangement mission. Play this game like you would with Day Z, with extreme caution and planning, as one wrong move can get you or your group members killed.Review 3: I am drawing near to the end of the game. I have actually got my chef killed at the hands of a feral which ripped him in half like a chocolate bar; now I am not sure if I want that achievment on my steam profile. I managed to build up an arsenal of weapons, which include 100+ melee weapons and 50+ guns (which include a few Automatic rifles and 2 50 Calibre rifles). fighting zombies is no easier with these guns as the ammo for my 50 cal guns are so rare that I only managed to collect 30+ rounds, this is further worsened by the guns stumbling recoil and extreme weight that can encumber a non powerhouse character. Since I am near the end I may as well just give you some tips for surviving the zombie apocalyse of State Of Decay. 1. When setting up a new home, always make sure you prioritise building a workshop and infirmary (and if possible a medical lab if you can get a library). This is because if you get injured or sick group members you can heal them back up to good health quickly, meaning they can hone their skills and do scavenging runs for you; having a workshop means you can repair your veichles which are very limited in this game aswell as make very important homemade supressors which benefit all of your characters. 2. Dont use inexperienced characters for tougher jobs. this is how my chef got killed. I sent him out to help an ally deal with a few zeds attacking her and what happens when I complete it? A feral an armoured zombies come after me and since ferals are the strongest and worst zed to face in the game, I was screwed with my 22. pistol and pipe wrench. The moral of the story is train you charcters, but always have an ally with you incase the freaks come knocking.3. USE STEALTH!!! Now yes stealth can be slow especially when scavenging, but it pays off as you will deal with less zeds and you will be less likely to get injured or killed. If there are zeds closing in on you while you are searching a container, then search it quicker and risk making noise as you will already have zombies trying to get through the doors and windows. If a horde spots you then either run away and find a car to escape or ram the horde, you could even (if you have the weapons and ammo) engage and destroy the horde so long as it doesnt attract more attention.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												Short Version Review:"Crashed a pickup truck into a guard rail, got stuck, got beset my 20 zombies pouring out of the nearest house and lived !  Thank you, sledge hammer!  Then rammed a junky little sports car into the truck over and over until it was off the rail.  Got the truck back, left the burning car .... Thumbs Up !!!"Slightly Lengthier Review:So far, so good !  To start, I'll begin with the disclaimer of "I've never played a zombie apocalypse game before this one."  Unless you count some of the Fallout Games ( mmmm ... a lot of those mutants were pretty similar to zombies ).  Anyways, after a couple of crash n' burns both figurative and literal, I'm on my 3rd run of this game and it's a pretty fun romp.  There's a whole steamin' pile of paranoia to be had exploring in the towns, trying to keep one eye on the stuff you're trying to scavenge, and another eye out the window for things that might be jumping through it, trying to eat you.  An ear to the ground also helps.  Screamers are no picnic.  And it also might help to drive a little better than me, b/c when I see a mass of zombies coming down the street at me, my gas pedal foot gets a mind of its own.  I've dented enough hoods, lost enough car doors, and blown up enough vehicles to fill a modest junkyard already.  Hmmm, and I'm still just barely into the storyline itself, b/c the act of survival from day to day is a story all on its own.Of course, no game's complete without at least a few gripes.  I wish some of the NPCs weren't so petty or inherently stupid.  Nothing says " HEY, WE'RE OVER HERE !!! " quite like the sentry on the tower wielding a shotgun instead of a high powered rifle and shooting multiple times at zombies on the fringe of shotgun range.  There used to be an ornery guy with a hat on the tower - he was a jerk, but at least he had a rifle - can't figure out how to get the girl with the shotgun to come down and put the sniper guy back up there .... or convince her to swap weapons ...The other gripes are fairly mild in comparison.  It's been a bit of a trick for me trying to figure out where the main storyline wandered off to after my original party stumbled half-chewed into this church compound.  We've been fighting to keep our sanity and our skins ever since.  Having a whole lotta fun, though - $5 well spent.

												I had my doubts about State of Decay, suspecting yet another shark hunting the blood of Day Z fans.  I was wrong, and I am very happy to be wrong.  I enjoy this.  It's a fair bit strategic, and a fair bit luck based.  It's all built around survival, maintaining and upgrading a base and outposts, as well as recruiting survivors to your group and keeping them happy.  Oh, and there's zombies too, and they're♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥  This game is punishing, even on the easiest difficulty.  Sometimes it's downright unfair, BUT you can learn from your mistakes, learn the game, and get better.  My #1 gripe here is that there's no coop, and I hear a sequel with coop is already in the works, so we'll see.  Great buy for me.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
												Open world, third person survival zombie game with choice based missions.- Has a story and a plot, that goes like most good zombie series.- Day/night cycle. Zombies become more aggressive at night.- Kill, explore, gain allies, gather ressources and build bases/outposts.- Switch between characters. Life, stamina and injuries are essential factors.- Skill system for each character making them good at different tasks.- Use cars to drive around the map and slaughter zombies.- A lot of different weapons including swords, machetes, snipers, shotguns, assault rifles, grenade launchers etc.In generel good/bad:- A lot to explore. The gameplay is addictive and fun.- Graphics are ok and sounds are good. - Controls not the best, but can be played. Cars are stiff in handling. (console port).- It has no MP, but does not need it, as the SP is satisfying long enough, to keep you going.Similar game(s): - It reminds me a bit of Dead Island, which I played on the PS3. That game went more fluid for me than this one.However Dead Island is much more linear than State of Decay. Also Dead Island is easier than State of Decay.Score: 9/10.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												This game is completely amazing! Nothing more satisfying than hearing the music ramp up as I knee zombies in the face, splattering beautiful guts all over the place with a marvelous crush sound. The sounds and animations are completely gorgeous and well done, using a sword and slicing through zombies feels sooooooooooo damn good!The game takes good things from all sorts of genres, it has great elements of role playing, strategy, action, survival, shooters and even stealth sims. The game has great replayabilty and is highly addictive, warning!There are definitely things that could be improved. Some missions and when or where they pop up are really annoying. losing characters is very sad (kind of a good thing maybe), carrying rucksacks gets very old, NPCs on scavenger missions just stand there even with zombies around. Overall though, I might complain, but the game is so completely awesome, it's so good that any problem feels meaningless.GREAT GAME.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
												It's a decent game, but I'm still giving this one as well as the Breakdown DLC a thumbs down.The game starts out quite promising, but turns out to be repetitive and boring as soon as you've established a decent home base. The zombie sandbox seems vast at first, but excitement fades when you realize that the houses are pretty much the same everywhere. There aren't that many interesting items or people to find. And even though Breakdown seemingly adds more challenge to the game, things get pretty easy as soon as you've established a home base and started upgrading your characters. Your neighbors are super needy, you constantly need new equipment for your home base and there's always some shmuck that has to be saved or a zombie horde that has to be mowed down. In the end you just drive repetitively from one waypoint to another until you've helped everyone with their needy needs and the game is over.At worst the zombies are mildly annoying. The fight system doesn't offer much immersion. You just keep clicking and "smash spacebar not to die". The game would have benefited from a more hands on fight system like they had in Condemned.State of Decay had some redeeming qualities, mainly the way you're able to earn people's trust and create a community of survivors. The scripted events breathe life into the characters who are actually able to do some useful stuff on their own while you're completing missions. And if they die you can't bring them back. The graphics are pretty okay and there's a satisfying POK sound when your baseball bat hits an armored zombie's helmet.The game is very ambitious, and while it doesn't suck horribly, I still feel it falls short.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												I really like how this game focuses on survival and fighting off zombies. Once you build a community you have to go out and gather ressources to survive, and don't be careless out there because you will get overrun and killed. The fighting system is really simple and fun wether you choose to go melee or use guns. The zombies animations and movements are nice and fluid and thier artificial intelligence is simple and well done. They react to sound and light and will run to you if you make too much noise. You can still sneak around them, especially in the dark and score a few stealth melee kills wich is always nice. I also like how you can choose to build your community by finding more survivor, controlling certain characters to level them up and get them to learn new abilities and be stronger. You have quite a big map to explore as well, a lot of scavenging to do. You have to be carefull to keep the zombie population in check around your home base so it doesn't get overrun. The gameplay is really fun and well done. And of course, among all of that, you have a nice little quest story line that gets you to learn about what  happened and what caused all this. Although not everything is answered at the end of the game it opens the door for a nice sequel or expansion. I give this game a 9 out of 10 because the only downside is that you cannot bring your friends to play with you in co-op... how awesome would it have been.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												SoD stands out in a sea of mediocre zombie games. Going in, I really didn't expect to like this game as much as I eventually did. Though a little rough around the edges it still offers up some solid and, often exhilarating, gameplay. Most of your time will be spent sneaking around scavenging for supplies (food, ammo, fuel, & medicine), managing/saving/assisting other survivors, improving your base with various facilities related to your survival (workshops, medical tents, sleeping quarters, etc.) and...running for your life. Zombies can be quite challenging in groups especially if there are a few 'special' infected mixed in. It's a good idea to always bring a battle buddy.  As for complaints; I would like to see more story/character depth, more and/or improved graphics options, and polished up combat. Long range gun play can be dodgy. Missions can become a bit repetitive, especially after several levels of Breakdown, but even an average mission can turn heart pumping if you find yourself surrounded, wounded, and on the run. Altogether, State of Decay is a fun mix of elements from the zombie genre that does a lot of things right, if not deeply. Well worth picking up when you can catch it on a Steam sale.

												Loved this game and lost more than a few weekeds to it. Tension, plot and difficulty and perma-death! It definitely hooked me into a "just one more supply run" mentality. The story was enough to develop the characters, but did not interfere when I just wanted to run missions. I refused to start the final mission, always wanting to clear out one more infestation and scout out the next building. All that said, there are so many ways I'd love to see this franchise expanded upon-  co-op multiplayer, more advanced base building, for instance. The zombie AI is just average and melee combat can be a bit repetitive (I'm too much of an ammo conservationist apparently).

content:
Posted: January 26, 2014
												State of decay is an amazing zombie survival game. It doesn't rely heavily on the "jumpscare" which I love. The game isn't soley built on fighting zombies. It's about surviving the long game. In order to succeed you need to scavange, set up outposts, upgrade your home base. You need to look for weapons for yourself, but also buidling, medical, food, and ammo supplies for your group to survive.You need to manage relationships with other groups of survivors by rescuing them, or ignoring the pleas for help so you can run another mission that you need for supplies. You need to manage your folks as well, playing as one character can hurt you in the long run, you need to play multiple folks and level them up as well. If your singlely played character dies you're in for a long tough road ahead.  The game does a great job reminding you of this as each player will fatigue when they've been outside the safe zone for too long, so you are reminded that you need to swap characters.The best part is for a zombie survival game you dont' need to kill zombies. There are no drops, no added bonus to offing them, other than keeping you and your home safe, so hiding in bushes, or staying quiet to save ammo and mele weapons isn't peanized one bit. I'm 10 hours in and only feel like I"ve started. but I can't stop playing, everything else in my library sits idle while I contine to fight for the living.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I personally really enjoyed this game. The game has some bugs and glitches here and there but from my experience ive had nothing game-breaking. If you are to get the game just to kill zombies and just explore I recomend getting the Breakdown DLC. I spent most of my time on that. The story is alright but nothing too great. A small list of some pros and cons.Pro- Some what classic zombie, they run but can only be killed by damaging the brain.Pro- Great mechanics such as building up a base with survivors and gear to survive the hordes, a rouge like system that has you play as multiable characters but if he/she dies you can no longer play as him/her, cars will never respawn after you destroy them. Pro. Different types of zombie found all over the map.Pro- A large map that has many places to settle in and explore.Pro- Many different types of weapons from melee to guns.Con- Zombies will glitch that causes them to not load in correctly so its just their head and arms.Con- (personal con) I dislike the survivor walking animation. Con- Survivor AI can glitch causes them to just stand still and die. Con- Sadly no co-op or multiplayer. I deeply wish they added that in. State of Decay is a pretty fun game, when your done with the base game you can always get the Breakdown DLC that makes the game harder and it ends when you die or the Lifeline DLC that ands a new map and a new story. :D

												This game is simply too much fun. I have not found any glaring faults as yet, though I do wish vehicles carried more items (a kitchen timer should not really take up the same space as a duffle bag in the back of a pickup truck) and that fully metal weapons, such as a pipe, lasted far, far longer than they do.Deaths are real, and as a character dies you are stuck with whomever is left. While that does not change the game itself, it does limit what you are able to do later in the game if you have not been working on all the available characters' skills. I consider this a bonus, as it prevents the game from getting boring.Vehicle stability is reminiscent of Grand Theft Auto. This is a good thing.I have not played The Walking Dead series, so I have no basis for comparison. All I can really say, is that I have a ton of fun in this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												In many ways this is the beginnings of the zombie game I have been waiting for. A zombie survival game with an "end game" - survivor communities.As it stands I enjoyed what State of Decay offers, but perhaps I have enjoyed it more as a proof of concept than anything else. The world of State of Decay is well realised, and the scale is spot on - the map is full of various points of interest without being too cluttered. The story elements are decent enough as you are guided through the game world - although you do have to fill in a lot of the blanks yourself.There is a lot missing, most notably human enemies / survivor wars - one group in particular I swear was leading up to this... nope. Why am I watching a zombie climb over a barbed wire fence? Hmm. There are some oddities found throughout the game like this.Beyond the survivor communities mechanic, vehicles add a joyous experience to the "zombie murdering" genre (if I can call it that). State of Decay's animations are mostly great (if jerky at times) and the graphics, while dated, are charming. The way zombies move and you combat them is much better realised here than in other zombie survival games. Melee combat is nicely played too.All in all I recommend this game, if only to support Undead Labs' future work. If State of Decay is any indication, we're in good hands.UPDATE: Lifeline DLC was quite fun - great to get a new map to explore, and a few new characters. Definitely worth a few dollars if you'd like to journey back into the world of State of Decay. Some welcome enhancements, too: vehicle storage and automatic unloading of supplies are awesome.

												I had my doubts about State of Decay, suspecting yet another shark hunting the blood of Day Z fans.  I was wrong, and I am very happy to be wrong.  I enjoy this.  It's a fair bit strategic, and a fair bit luck based.  It's all built around survival, maintaining and upgrading a base and outposts, as well as recruiting survivors to your group and keeping them happy.  Oh, and there's zombies too, and they're♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥  This game is punishing, even on the easiest difficulty.  Sometimes it's downright unfair, BUT you can learn from your mistakes, learn the game, and get better. content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												I would definately recommend this game to anyone who enjoys playing zombie killing games, I loved it!A brief summary about this game: - Its singleplayer and has a great main story (it also has plenty of side missions) - It has a large open world so you can run off to explore and scavenge for resourcres when you want - During the story more new bases become available that you can move to (and upgrade to add different types of rooms eg library, garden, repairshop, etc all with different benefits) if you choose- You meet new survivors and they can join your group and you can change to control each one when you are friendly enough- Each survivor has different traits and you can choose different fight styles to level up - You can use vehicles to move around the map quickly but noise attracts zeds- There are different types of zombies to fight (eg: ones that explode) - When you exit the game real time continues ingame and so depending on how many days it is before you login different things can happen without you, usually resoucres used for different events so you need to build them up again or you need to talk to another survivor who is upset/angry and not coping well.Although there are so many alpha zombie games right now and state of decay is older and only singleplayer, I still believe its a classic and worth grabbing in a sale :)

The zombie sandbox seems vast at first, but excitement fades when you realize that the houses are pretty much the same everywhere. There aren't that many interesting items or people to find. And even though Breakdown seemingly adds more challenge to the game, things get pretty easy as soon as you've established a home base and started upgrading your characters. Your neighbors are super needy, you constantly need new equipment for your home base and there's always some shmuck that has to be saved or a zombie horde that has to be mowed down. In the end you just drive repetitively from one waypoint to another until you've helped everyone with their needy needs and the game is over.At worst the zombies are mildly annoying. The fight system doesn't offer much immersion. You just keep clicking and "smash spacebar not to die". The game would have benefited from a more hands on fight system like they had in Condemned.State of Decay had some redeeming qualities, mainly the way you're able to earn people's trust and create a community of survivors. The scripted events breathe life into the characters who are actually able to do some useful stuff on their own while you're completing missions. And if they die you can't bring them back. 												No Multiplayer?Besides that heres my thoughts... The game impressed me during the first play the game feels like an open world with zombies appearing anywhere and they roam around which keeps you on your toes.I like the RPG element where you level up and choose which character abilities you want to use for fighting, you can also choose different type of weapons, like blunt, slashing rifles, handguns etc.. Another thing I like about this game is it can be challenging, unlike a lot of zombie games you can go around just killing at will... In this game at any time you can be overpowered by a horde of zombies and taken down as you can run out of energy and get winded.. Ammo can sometimes be sparse as well as you are limited to carrying space.The downside is the game can start to get repetitive after awhile which is when I was hoping they had a multiplayer option which would make it a lot more fun.
